Entries.default:
"We should never have accepted your backwards kind among the Circle."

The masked man - Aedyran by his accent and shrouded in robe and cowl - stands with a hand outstretched towards the Huana woman.
The aumaua shudders to a standing position. Fungus sheathes her features, and through the lichen and mold you can make out deep gashes and mottled burns.
In your mind's eye, you make out the memory of the archmage Maura at the bookshelves. The guttering vision pulls down tomes and scans them quickly before returning them to their places.
"You cannot kill me. There are rules." Blood oozes from a gash across her forehead.
"The Circle would crash upon you like the breaking wrath of Ngati herself."

"The forces at work here are older than the Circle. Not to mention that the Circle seems to have forgotten me here - forgotten even who I am."

Flames ring his closed fist.

"You think they won't find out? That they won't come for you? They're the most powerful individuals in Eora."

The air shimmers with heat.
"How do you think they'll fare against the titan of Wael? Let them come."
Shoulders squared, head high, the robed figure turns on you. He looks almost regal.
"The late arrivals, then. Allies of Maura, I presume? Tools of the Circle?"
"I've searched every other chamber in this godsforsaken isle. The sacrifice must be here." She pulls down a scroll.
"I will find it. I will satisfy their godsdamned device. It will grant me access to the body."
"The foreign god will fall. Crushed by Wael's hand. By mine." The aumaua archmage's aura spikes with rage.

"And the pieces plunged into the depths."

She stiffens, suddenly silent, and looks over her shoulder - past you.

"Who's there? Show yourself!"

She stands and straightens as a familiar masked figure steps out of the shadows.
The figures fade as the vision shimmers, breaks apart, and retreats from your sight.
She turns a cloudy eye upon you. The other dangles from its socket, thick mold growing around the nerves.
"Greetings."
"You got some, uh, stuff on you."
"Maura? What happened to you?"
[Attack] "Let's cut to the killing you."
"Nourishment. Consumption. Preparation."

"Slake. Consume. Grow."

The archmage's remaining eye lingers on you.

"Watcher? Whisperer?"

The aumaua - or what used to be an aumaua - twitches and licks its dry lips.
"Something tells me this isn't the Maura of legend. Perhaps it's the dangling eye."
"Might be she ain't too keen on what you did to the rest of the spores."
"What if we dispensed with the 'consume' part and went our separate ways?" Maia steps back.
"Whatever she has become, it is no life worthy of the word."
"Certainly weren't what I were expecting of an arch-wizard, cap."
"My lady, deepest condolences for your fungal friends. I trust they will... grow back in time?"
"Look here, fungus face - ain't nobody doing a reaping here but us."
"This is little more than a puppet of the larger spore system we encountered earlier. Yet it seems - broken somehow. As if a part of her still clings to what she was."
"It's Champion, actually."
"The beginning of many a successful conversation." Sighing, Fassina draws her weapon.
"I think maybe we should stab her."
"Yes, yes. That is what the Duskspeaker is."
"Ingest..."

"Slayer. Destroyer."

The archmage's remaining eye focuses on you even as her muscles tense.
With a low, gurgling roar, the creature turns on you.
"Don't suppose I can convince you to not eat me?"
"There must be some way to reverse this!"
"If the spores can access the memories and powers of an archmage, that could present a danger to, well, everyone."

"Eat? Devour."

She stumbles towards you.

"Nurture. Feed."

Her mouth hangs open, the tongue lolling out past triangular teeth.
"Some way besides eating me, I mean."
"Seek... Spread... Survive..."
"Writhe in darkness. Lurk. Watch."
"Drink. Sup. Slurp?"
"You are Maura, right?"
"Yes, that's me. Who are you?"
"Well that's certainly a daring look."
"You're connected to the spores below, aren't you?"
"Sp-spread. Growth. Claim. Amb-ambulate."
"Uh, ambu- what?"
"Ambulate? That's a you word, cap."
"Well, dang, Maura, ain't that a ten-fenning word!"

"Scour."

She takes a halting step towards you, her one good eye hungrily searching you.
"Depths. Center. Spread."
"Be careful - even in this state, she may have access to her wizardry."
"Hey, you made yourself a friend. Kinda." He rubs the back of his head.
"If you don't start making sense, it'll be my weapon that does the talking next."
"Whoever she was, this thing is a danger to us now."
"Strange to say, cap, but I be thinking this lass be at least half related to the mushrooms you made parley with down below."
"No need for hostilities, my lady. What say we discuss this over a moist log, or... whatever it is that fungus enjoys most?" Tekēhu tips his head to the side and attempts a smile.
"Should we guide her, or uh, it - them? - towards the light?"
"This is little more than a puppet of the larger spore system we encountered earlier. Yet it seems - broken somehow. As if a part of her still clings to what she was."
"You think this infestation remembers how to cast a spell?" Fassina's hand drops to her weapon.
"I'm searching, too. Or rather, I was looking for Maura. Or what Maura was doing."
"If you've consumed Maura, you may know why she was here."
"Curtail your scouring before I curtail it for you."
"If the spores can access the memories and powers of an archmage, that could present a danger to, well, everyone."
Maura's head cocks to the side slightly, setting her loose eye to swinging back and forth.
[Attack] "Your spread ends here."
The creature raises her arms as a mist of spores billows around her.

The creature's posture straightens, but it head declines in a shallow nod.

It almost seems to be considering your words.
"Show. Watch."
The spore-infested archmage watches you.
"Thank you."
"Farewell, Maura."
"So what do you plan to do now?"
"Search. Spread."
The aumaua's cracked lips curl at one side. You're not certain it's a smile.
"Carry on, then."
"Found anything interesting?"
"Survive. Sift. Still."
"Tell me what I need to know, witch."
"Who are you? How did you find this place?"
[Watch quietly for now.]
"Leave her be!"
"Whatever's going on here, we can resolve it peaceably."
"I was wondering when I'd get to kill something with an actual mind."

The aumaua spares you a brief glance before returning her focus on the wizard before her. 

If he notices you at all, you can't tell through the mask.
"Lackeys, Maura? No matter. You and I are almost through here."
The robed man barks out a harsh laugh at your interjection.

"A tad late for that, I'm afraid."

He shifts his mask briefly towards you.
"You cannot move against me. The Circle will not allow it."
"What's the meaning of this?"
"No!"
[Narrow your eyes.]
"I hope you're ready to die, bastard!"
"It's Maura! But who is that she's speaking with?"
"She needs our help. Apretta! Our only hope for answers is about to bleed out."
"Ekera, where is it?"
"And then it's merely a matter of adapting the summoning."
"Maura? Are you... alive in there?"
"You're one to talk, Duskspeaker."
"I saw you die."
"We know where Maura ended up - but not why she was here or what that other wizard wants."
"Do you know anything about it, spore?"

"Slake. Consume. Grow."

The archmage's remaining eye lingers on you.
"That be thrice-fucking creepy, cap." Serafen shudders.
"Heh. See, she was real friendly after all."
"Was that the lesson you took from this?"
"Friendly? I am not convinced that you fully understand what that word means, Edér." Pallegina shakes her head and turns away.
"Better that we take this chance to leave than risk the infestation spreading." Fassina takes you by the arm and firmly ushers you away.
"Serafen, we're in no position to be insulting our good friends now, are we?" Maia smiles at Maura and nods slowly.
"Don't! Gahhhhhhhhhh-"
"Am-bu-late? To move, I think. A good word. I will remember that one."
"The creepiest." He shudders from his head to his feet.
"We should not leave her this way, Watcher. It is not... right."
"I doubt the capacity of a wizard without a grimoire to enforce rules."
Maura's charred corpse smokes silently on the tile floor.

"Hello again, Maura."

Fyonlecg's voice slithers from the darkness.
